budget

Class Budget

  • java.lang.Object
    • budget.Budget

  • public class Budget
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a Budget or an Offer. The object is created from the data in the database. The object contains basic information about the budget, provides methods to get its Client, the Salesperson of the Client, the User who created the budget, to get the Total, to get its documents, attachments, annotations... The sections array must be ordered before being added to the budget. It is added to the budget when requested. The arrays returned by the methods must be ordered before being processed by the class.
    Author:
    oscar

    • Constructor Detail

      • Budget

        public Budget(boolean isOffer,
              java.lang.String budgetId,
              long creationDate,
              long expirationDate,
              Client client,
              java.lang.String constructionRef,
              User author,
              java.lang.String note,
              boolean hasGlobalTotal,
              float taxRate,
              Cover cover,
              Salesperson signer)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        isOffer - True if offer, false if budget
        budgetId - The ID of the budget
        creationDate - The creation date in ms
        expirationDate - The expiration date in ms
        client - The client of the budget
        constructionRef - The construction reference
        author - The user that made the budget
        note - A final note in the budget
        hasGlobalTotal - Total of all sections or spare each section
        taxRate - The percentage of taxes
        cover - The selected cover
        signer - The administrator that signed the offer

        public boolean isExpired()
        Returns true if the current date is newer than the expiration date
        Returns:
        True if the expiration date is outdated

      • hasGlobalTotal

        public boolean hasGlobalTotal()
        Returns globalTotal attribute If it is true all sections are part of a budget and will be added in a total. If it is false, each sections acts as a different budget.
        Returns:
        True if the sections are part of the total

      • getTaxRate

        Returns taxRate attribute as percentage
        Returns:
        Percentage of taxes

      • getTotal

        public float getTotal()
        Returns the sum of all sections total in the creation date. If not hasGlobalTotal returns -1
        Returns:
        The sum of all sections total

      • getCurrentTotal

        public float getCurrentTotal()
        Returns the sum of all sections total if the creation date were now. If not hasGlobalTotal returns -1
        Returns:
        The sum of all sections total

      • getTotalPlusTaxes

        public float getTotalPlusTaxes()
        Returns the sum of all sections total plus taxes in the creation date. If not hasGlobalTotal returns -1

      • getAnnotations

        public Annotation[] getAnnotations()
        Returns the annotations of the budget. If it is null returns an empty string. Method uses BudgetDAO and budgetDB.

        The attachments of the budget

      • getFamily

        public Budget[] getFamily()
        Returns the family of the budget. The family are the other budgets and offers created as a new version of any of the budgets and offers in the family. If it is null returns an empty string. Method uses BudgetDAO and budgetDB.
        Returns:
        A list of budgets of the same family

      • getCover

        public Cover getCover()
        Returns the cover of the budget
        Returns:
        The selected cover of the budget

      • check

        public java.lang.Integer[] check()
        Check if all the data introduced in the budget is possible: No empty sections, has all the attributes filled, the client has a salesperson, etc
        Returns:
        a list of integers: Empty if the budget is correct. Errors: -1 if isExpired, -2 if not have author, -3 if not have client, -4 if the client does not have salesperson, -5 if there is an empty section, -6 if there are no sections, -13 if the client is not active, -14 if there are discontinued products. Advertises: 7 if there is a product with no quantity, 8 if there is no final note, 9 if there is no tax rate, 10 if there is a section with no name, 11 if there is any discount negative, 12 if there is no construction reference, 15 if the salesperson is not enabled.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Check if all the data introduced in the budget is possible: No empty sections, has all the attributes filled, the client has a salesperson, etc
        Returns:
        true if the budget is valid

        public int getCoverId()
